item.title: Homemade Cruffins
item.description: Indulge in the delightful combination of croissants and muffins with these homemade cruffins. Buttery, flaky, and filled with cinnamon-sugar goodness, they are a perfect treat for any occasion. | ⏱️ Prep: 285min | Cook: 25min | Serves: 12 | #cat1758062873138 #mediumrecipe #recipe #cooking #foodie
item.dc:creator: author_003
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 285 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 25 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 310 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 12

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 cup whole milk, warmed to about 110°F (43°C)
  • 2 and 1/4 teaspoons instant or active dry yeast
  • 3 tablespoons granulated sugar
  • 3 tablespoons unsalted or salted butter, softened
  • 3 cups all-purpose flour, plus more as needed
  • 1 and 1/4 teaspoons salt
  • 1 cup salted butter, slightly softened for lamination
  • 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour for lamination
  • 3/4 cup granulated sugar for filling
  • 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon for filling
  • optional fillings: Nutella, jam, lemon curd, or pastry cream

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Whisk the warm milk, yeast, and sugar together in a stand mixer bowl. Cover and let sit for 5 minutes until foamy.
  2. Add butter, 2 cups of flour, and salt. Beat on medium speed for 2 minutes. Add remaining flour and beat on low until a soft dough forms.
  3. Knead the dough for 5 minutes until it is soft and slightly tacky. Perform the windowpane test to check readiness.
  4. Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover, and let rise for about 2 hours until nearly double in size.
  5. Gently punch down the dough and flatten it into a 10x14-inch rectangle. Refrigerate for 20 minutes.
  6. Prepare the lamination butter by beating it with 1 tablespoon of flour until combined.
  7. Spread the butter on the center third of the dough and fold the edges over to enclose the butter. Roll out to a 9x12-inch rectangle and refrigerate for 20 minutes.
  8. Repeat the lamination process two more times, rolling and folding the dough, refrigerating in between.
  9. Lightly grease a muffin pan. Mix sugar and cinnamon in a bowl.
  10. Roll out the dough into an 8x12-inch rectangle, sprinkle with cinnamon-sugar, and cut into 12 strips.
  11. Layer 3 strips together, roll them up, and place in the muffin pan. Repeat for all strips.
  12. Cover the cruffins and let rise for 1 hour until puffy.
  13. Preheat the oven to 350°F (177°C). Bake for 25-28 minutes until golden and the internal temperature reaches 200°F (93°C).
  14. Roll the cruffins in cinnamon-sugar and fill with your choice of filling if desired.

item.title: Sweet Cinnamon Twists
item.description: Sweet Cinnamon Twists are a delightful pastry treat that combines the flakiness of puff pastry with a gooey, sweet cinnamon filling. Perfect for breakfast, dessert, or a sweet snack with your coffee, these twists are sure to impress with their delicious taste and Instagram-worthy appearance. | ⏱️ Prep: 15min | Cook: 20min | Serves: 4 | #cat1757766030517 #easyrecipe #1hourmeals #recipe #cooking
item.dc:creator: author_003
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 20 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 35 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 4

📊 Difficulty: Easy

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 sheet puff pastry, defrosted (about 8 oz)
  • ¼ cup granulated sugar
  • 1 tsp ground cinnamon
  • ½ cup butter, melted
  • 1 egg (for egg wash, optional)
  • Powdered sugar for decoration (optional)

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
  2. Roll out the puff pastry on a lightly floured surface to about 1/8 inch thick.
  3. In a small bowl, mix the granulated sugar and cinnamon together.
  4. Brush the rolled-out pastry with the melted butter, then sprinkle the cinnamon-sugar mixture generously over the surface.
  5. Cut the dough into 1-inch wide strips. Twist each strip several times, then place them on the prepared baking sheet.
  6. Brush each twist with an egg wash (optional) and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until golden brown and puffed up.
  7. Allow the twists to cool slightly, then dust with powdered sugar if desired and serve immediately.

item.title: Elegant White Chocolate Mousse Tartlets
item.description: Delicate and creamy, these White Chocolate Mousse Tartlets are the perfect dessert for any occasion. Each bite combines a buttery crisp crust with smooth, luscious mousse that melts in your mouth, finished with fresh raspberries and a drizzle of caramel. | ⏱️ Prep: 30min | Serves: 6 | #cat1757766030517 #mediumrecipe #quickrecipe #30minutemeals #recipe
item.dc:creator: author_003
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 30 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 0 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 30 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 6

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 150 g graham cracker crumbs
  • 80 g unsalted butter, melted
  • 200 g white chocolate, chopped
  • 240 ml heavy whipping cream
  • 120 g cream cheese, softened
  • 50 g powdered sugar
  • 100 g fresh raspberries
  • 30 ml caramel sauce
  • edible flowers (optional)

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Prepare the crust by combining graham cracker crumbs and melted butter, then chill for 20 minutes.
  2. Melt white chocolate gently over a double boiler and cool slightly.
  3. Whip heavy cream to soft peaks.
  4. Beat cream cheese and powdered sugar, fold in white chocolate, then fold in whipped cream.
  5. Pipe or spoon mousse into tartlet crusts.
  6. Garnish with raspberries, caramel drizzle, and edible flowers.

item.title: Strawberry Honeybun Cake Cream
item.description: Indulge in the delightful layers of moist vanilla cake swirled with cinnamon sugar and topped with a creamy strawberry icing. This Strawberry Honeybun Cake is a sweet and tangy treat that will impress your family and friends. | ⏱️ Prep: 15min | Cook: 35min | Serves: 12 | #cat1757766030517 #mediumrecipe #1hourmeals #recipe #cooking
item.dc:creator: author_003
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 35 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 50 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 12

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 box (15.25 oz) vanilla cake mix
  • 3 large eggs
  • 1 cup sour cream
  • ½ cup vegetable oil
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
  • ½ cup brown sugar
  • 1 cup diced strawberries
  • 2 cups powdered sugar
  • 2 tablespoons milk
  • ½ cup strawberry puree
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease and flour a 9x13 inch baking pan.
  2. In a large bowl, blend cake mix, eggs, sour cream, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract until smooth.
  3. Pour half the batter into prepared pan. Sprinkle half the cinnamon-sugar mixture evenly, then add half the diced strawberries. Repeat the layers with remaining batter, cinnamon-sugar, and strawberries.
  4. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Allow to cool for 10 to 15 minutes.
  5. Combine powdered sugar, milk, strawberry puree, and vanilla extract, adjusting milk quantity to achieve desired consistency.
  6. Drizzle icing over cooled cake and garnish with fresh strawberries as desired.

Its moist crumb and zesty aroma make it a standout dessert that captivates both the eyes and palate. | ⏱️ Prep: 15min | Cook: 50min | Serves: 14 | #cat1757766030517 #mediumrecipe #recipe #cooking #foodie
item.dc:creator: author_003
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 50 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 65 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 14

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 cup butter
  • 1 1/4 cups white sugar
  • 3 eggs
  • 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
  • 1 cup plain yogurt
  • 1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour
  • 3/4 teaspoon baking soda
  • 3/4 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • 2 tablespoons grated orange zest
  • 2 (1 ounce) squares unsweetened chocolate, melted
  • 2 tablespoons orange liqueur
  • 2 tablespoons orange juice
  • 1/4 cup white sugar (for glaze)

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour one 10-inch tube pan.
  2. In a large bowl, cream the butter with 1 cup of the white sugar until light and fluffy.
  3. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then add the vanilla extract and plain yogurt, mixing well.
  4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
  5. Gradually beat the dry ingredients into the creamed mixture until just combined.
  6. Divide the batter evenly into two bowls.
  7. Stir the grated orange zest into one bowl of batter.
  8. Add the melted unsweetened chocolate to the other bowl of batter and mix until smooth.
  9. Alternately spoon the orange and chocolate batters into the prepared tube pan.
  10. Use a knife to swirl through the batters gently, creating a marbled effect.
  11. Bake in the preheated oven for 50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
  12. While the cake is baking, mix the remaining 1/4 cup sugar with the orange juice and orange liqueur to make the glaze.
  13. As soon as the cake is removed from the oven, pour the glaze evenly over the hot cake.
  14. Allow the cake to cool completely on a wire rack before removing from the pan and serving.

item.dc:creator: author_004
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 50 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 65 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 10

📊 Difficulty: Moyen

🥘 Ingredients

  • 2 cups baking mix, such as Bisquick
  • 1 1/4 cups whole milk
  • 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, divided
  • 2 pounds lean ground beef
  • 1 onion, chopped
  • 2 poblano peppers, seeded and chopped
  • 1 packet taco seasoning
  • 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt
  • 1/2 cup mayonnaise
  • 1/2 cup sour cream, plus more for garnish
  • 2 cups shredded pepper Jack cheese, divided
  • 2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese, divided
  • 1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with Hatch green chiles, drained
  • 1/2 cup chopped cilantro or green onions for garnish

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Lightly coat a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
  2. Stir baking mix, milk, and 1 tablespoon oil together in a bowl. Spread evenly in the prepared baking dish.
  3. Bake in the preheated oven until just starting to turn golden brown, 10 to 15 minutes. This step is just par-baking - this layer will not be fully baked at this point. Remove from the oven and set aside.
  4. Heat remaining tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add ground beef and cook, stirring occasionally, until almost cooked through, about 4 minutes.
  5. Add onion and poblano, stirring occasionally, until the beef is cooked through and onions begin to soften, about 4 minutes more. Stir in taco seasoning and salt until evenly combined. Remove from heat; set aside.
  6. Add mayonnaise, sour cream, 1 cup pepper Jack cheese, and 1 cup Cheddar cheese to a bowl; stir until well combined.
  7. Spoon beef mixture evenly over par-baked biscuit in the baking dish. Sprinkle drained diced tomatoes evenly over beef. Carefully spoon mayonnaise mixture over beef and tomatoes. Sprinkle evenly with remaining shredded cheese.
  8. Bake, uncovered, until cheese is bubbly and starting to turn golden brown, about 30 minutes.
  9. Let the dish rest for 10 minutes before serving. Garnish with sour cream and cilantro or green onions.

This elegant dessert combines deep chocolate flavors with a hint of cherry and a velvety finish that will delight any crowd. | ⏱️ Prep: 30min | Cook: 40min | Serves: 12 | #cat1757766030517 #mediumrecipe #recipe #cooking #foodie
item.dc:creator: author_003
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 30 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 40 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 70 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 12

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 2/3 cups all-purpose flour
  • 2/3 cup unsweetened cocoa powder
  • 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • 1/2 cup shortening
  • 1 1/2 cups white sugar
  • 2 eggs
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 1/2 cups buttermilk
  • 1/2 cup kirschwasser (cherry liqueur)
  • 1/2 cup butter
  • 3 1/2 cups confectioners' sugar
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 1 teaspoon strong brewed coffee
  • 2 (14 ounce) cans pitted Bing cherries, drained
  • 2 cups heavy whipping cream
  • 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 tablespoon kirschwasser
  • 1 (1 ounce) square semisweet chocolate

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line the bottoms of two 8-inch round pans with parchment paper circles.
  2. Sift together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and 1 teaspoon salt. Set aside.
  3. Cream shortening and sugar until light and fluffy.
  4. Beat in eggs and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract until combined.
  5. Alternately beat in the flour mixture and buttermilk until just combined.
  6. Divide batter evenly between the two prepared pans and smooth the tops.
  7. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
  8. Cool cakes completely in pans, then remove parchment paper.
  9. Cut each cake layer horizontally in half to make 4 layers total.
  10. Sprinkle each layer evenly with 1/2 cup kirschwasser.
  11. In a medium bowl, cream butter until light and fluffy.
  12. Add confectioners' sugar, a pinch of salt, and brewed coffee; beat until smooth.
  13. If filling is too thick, add a few teaspoons of cherry juice or milk to reach spreadable consistency.
  14. Spread one-third of the filling on the first cake layer, then top with one-third of the drained cherries.
  15. Repeat layering with remaining cake layers, filling, and cherries.
  16. In a separate bowl, whip heavy cream to stiff peaks.
  17. Beat in 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract and 1 tablespoon kirschwasser.
  18. Frost the top and sides of the assembled cake with the whipped cream mixture.
  19. Use a potato peeler to shave curls from the semisweet chocolate square and sprinkle over the cake for garnish.

item.dc:creator: author_003
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 50 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 65 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 14

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 cup butter
  • 1 1/4 cups white sugar
  • 3 eggs
  • 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
  • 1 cup plain yogurt
  • 1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour
  • 3/4 teaspoon baking soda
  • 3/4 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • 2 tablespoons grated orange zest
  • 2 (1 ounce) squares unsweetened chocolate, melted
  • 2 tablespoons orange liqueur
  • 2 tablespoons orange juice
  • 1/4 cup white sugar (for glaze)

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour one 10-inch tube pan.
  2. In a large bowl, cream the butter with 1 cup of the white sugar until light and fluffy.
  3. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then add the vanilla extract and plain yogurt, mixing well.
  4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
  5. Gradually beat the dry ingredients into the creamed mixture until just combined.
  6. Divide the batter evenly into two bowls.
  7. Stir the grated orange zest into one bowl of batter.
  8. Add the melted unsweetened chocolate to the other bowl of batter and mix until smooth.
  9. Alternately spoon the orange and chocolate batters into the prepared tube pan.
  10. Use a knife to swirl through the batters gently, creating a marbled effect.
  11. Bake in the preheated oven for 50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
  12. While the cake is baking, mix the remaining 1/4 cup sugar with the orange juice and orange liqueur to make the glaze.
  13. As soon as the cake is removed from the oven, pour the glaze evenly over the hot cake.
  14. Allow the cake to cool completely on a wire rack before removing from the pan and serving.

With its smooth, custardy filling and golden crust, it’s a comforting dessert that brings joy to both young and old alike—perfect for sharing on any special occasion or cozy gathering. | ⏱️ Prep: 30min | Cook: 65min | Serves: 8 | #cat1758755241941 #mediumrecipe #recipe #cooking #foodie
item.dc:creator: author_003
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 30 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 65 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 95 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 8

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • ½ cup white sugar
  • ½ cup light brown sugar
  • ⅛ cup sifted all-purpose flour
  • ¼ teaspoon salt
  • ¼ cup milk
  • ¼ cup margarine
  • 1 egg yolk
  • 1 egg
  • ½ teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 (9 inch) unbaked pie crust

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  2. In a saucepan, combine white sugar, brown sugar, flour, and salt.
  3. Pour in milk and add margarine.
  4. Heat the mixture over medium heat, stirring constantly until the sugar dissolves and margarine is melted.
  5. Remove from heat and set aside to cool.
  6. In a large bowl, whisk together egg yolk, egg, and vanilla extract until smooth.
  7. Whisk the cooled sugar mixture into the eggs until fully combined.
  8. Pour the filling into the unbaked pie crust.
  9. Bake for 25 minutes at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  10. Reduce the oven temperature to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C) and bake for an additional 25 minutes, or until the top is puffed and edges are golden brown.
  11. Allow the pie to cool completely before slicing and serving.

item.title: Absolutely Ultimate Potato Soup
item.description: This creamy, comforting potato soup is the perfect warm-up on a chilly day, bursting with rich flavors from crispy bacon, fresh herbs, and velvety cream. Topped with crumbled bacon, green onions, or shredded Cheddar cheese, it’s a hearty treat that feels like a warm hug in a bowl. | ⏱️ Prep: 15min | Cook: 30min | Serves: 8 | #cat1758296513957 #mediumrecipe #1hourmeals #recipe #cooking
item.dc:creator: author_003
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 30 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 45 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 8

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 pound bacon, chopped
  • 2 stalks celery, diced
  • 1 onion, chopped
  • 3 cloves garlic, minced
  • 8 potatoes, peeled and cubed
  • 4 cups chicken stock, or enough to cover potatoes
  • 3 tablespoons butter
  • ¼ cup all-purpose flour
  • 1 cup heavy cream
  • 1 teaspoon dried tarragon
  • 3 teaspoons chopped fresh cilantro
  • salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Place bacon in a Dutch oven and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, 5 to 10 minutes.
  2. Drain bacon pieces on paper towels and drain off all but 1/4 cup of the bacon grease.
  3. Cook celery and onion in the reserved bacon drippings until onion is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
  4. Stir in garlic and continue cooking for 1 to 2 minutes.
  5. Add cubed potatoes and toss to coat. Sauté for 3 to 4 minutes.
  6. Return bacon to the pan and add enough chicken stock to just cover the potatoes.
  7. Cover and simmer until potatoes are tender, 15 to 20 minutes.
  8. Meanwhile, melt butter in a separate skillet over medium heat. Whisk in flour and cook, stirring constantly, 1 to 2 minutes.
  9. Whisk in heavy cream, tarragon, and cilantro.
  10. Bring cream mixture to a boil and cook, stirring constantly, until thickened, about 5 minutes.
  11. Add cream mixture to the potato mixture and stir to combine.
  12. Transfer about half of the soup to a blender and purée, then return to the Dutch oven.
  13. Adjust seasonings with salt and pepper to taste.
  14. Serve hot and enjoy!

item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 30 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 65 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 95 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 8

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • ½ cup white sugar
  • ½ cup light brown sugar
  • ⅛ cup sifted all-purpose flour
  • ¼ teaspoon salt
  • ¼ cup milk
  • ¼ cup margarine
  • 1 egg yolk
  • 1 egg
  • ½ teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 (9 inch) unbaked pie crust

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  2. In a saucepan, combine white sugar, brown sugar, flour, and salt.
  3. Pour in milk and add margarine.
  4. Heat the mixture over medium heat, stirring constantly until the sugar dissolves and margarine is melted.
  5. Remove from heat and set aside to cool.
  6. In a large bowl, whisk together egg yolk, egg, and vanilla extract until smooth.
  7. Gradually whisk the cooled sugar mixture into the egg mixture until fully combined.
  8. Pour the filling into the unbaked pie crust.
  9. Bake for 25 minutes at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  10. Reduce the oven temperature to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C) and bake for an additional 25 minutes, or until the top is puffed and edges are golden brown.
  11. Allow the pie to cool completely before slicing and serving.

item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 20 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 35 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 55 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 12

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 2 ¼ cups sifted all-purpose flour
  • 1 ⅛ cups warm milk
  • ¼ cup white sugar
  • 1 (0.25 ounce) package active dry yeast
  • 6 tablespoons butter, softened
  • 1 tablespoon vanilla extract
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 3 large apples - peeled, cored, and sliced
  • 1 cup white sugar
  • ¾ cup sifted all-purpose flour
  • 2 ounces candied lemon peel, chopped (optional)
  • ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon
  • ¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg
  • 1 pinch salt
  • ½ cup butter

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Grease the bottom and sides of a 9x13-inch baking dish or a 9-inch springform pan.
  2. In a large bowl, beat 2 ¼ cups flour, warm milk, ¼ cup sugar, yeast, softened butter, vanilla extract, and a pinch of salt with an electric mixer on high until the dough is smooth, about 5 minutes.
  3. Spread the dough evenly into the prepared baking dish, pressing it up the sides.
  4. Press the peeled, cored, and sliced apples evenly into the dough.
  5. In a separate bowl, mix 1 cup sugar, ¾ cup flour, candied lemon peel (if using), cinnamon, nutmeg, and a pinch of salt.
  6. Cut in ½ cup butter with a knife or pastry blender until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
  7. Sprinkle the crumb mixture evenly over the apples.
  8. Allow the dough to rise for 30 minutes in a warm place.
  9. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
  10. Bake the cake in the preheated oven until golden brown and the apples are tender, about 35 minutes.

item.dc:creator: author_003
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 30 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 40 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 70 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 12

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 2/3 cups all-purpose flour
  • 2/3 cup unsweetened cocoa powder
  • 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • 1/2 cup shortening
  • 1 1/2 cups white sugar
  • 2 eggs
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 1/2 cups buttermilk
  • 1/2 cup kirschwasser
  • 1/2 cup butter
  • 3 1/2 cups confectioners' sugar
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 1 teaspoon strong brewed coffee
  • 2 (14 ounce) cans pitted Bing cherries, drained
  • 2 cups heavy whipping cream
  • 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 tablespoon kirschwasser
  • 1 (1 ounce) square semisweet chocolate

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line the bottoms of two 8-inch round pans with parchment paper circles.
  2. Sift together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and 1 teaspoon salt. Set aside.
  3. Cream shortening and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract.
  4. Alternately beat in flour mixture and buttermilk until just combined.
  5. Pour batter evenly into the prepared pans.
  6. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
  7. Cool cakes completely, then remove parchment paper.
  8. Cut each cake layer in half horizontally to make 4 layers total.
  9. Sprinkle each layer evenly with 1/2 cup kirschwasser.
  10. In a medium bowl, cream butter until light and fluffy. Add confectioners' sugar, pinch of salt, and brewed coffee; beat until smooth. If too thick, add a couple teaspoons of cherry juice or milk.
  11. Spread one-third of the buttercream filling over the first cake layer, then top with one-third of the drained cherries. Repeat for remaining layers.
  12. In a separate bowl, whip heavy cream to stiff peaks. Beat in 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract and 1 tablespoon kirschwasser.
  13. Frost the top and sides of the cake with the whipped cream mixture.
  14. Use a potato peeler to shave curls from the semisweet chocolate and sprinkle over the cake for decoration.

item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 10 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 40 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 50 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 8

📊 Difficulty: Easy

🥘 Ingredients

  • 3 cups rolled oats
  • 1 cup brown sugar, or to taste
  • 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
  • 2 teaspoons baking powder
  • 1 teaspoon salt, or to taste
  • 2 large eggs
  • 1 cup milk
  • ½ cup melted butter
  • 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
  • ¾ cup dried cranberries

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  2. In a large bowl, mix together oats, brown sugar, cinnamon, baking powder, and salt.
  3. Beat in eggs, milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract until well combined.
  4. Stir in dried cranberries.
  5. Spread the mixture evenly into a 9x13-inch baking dish.
  6. Bake in the preheated oven until the top is golden and set, about 40 minutes.
  7. Remove from oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving.
  8. Serve warm, topped with milk if desired.

item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 30 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 45 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 8

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 pound bacon, chopped
  • 2 stalks celery, diced
  • 1 onion, chopped
  • 3 cloves garlic, minced
  • 8 potatoes, peeled and cubed
  • 4 cups chicken stock, or enough to cover potatoes
  • 3 tablespoons butter
  • ¼ cup all-purpose flour
  • 1 cup heavy cream
  • 1 teaspoon dried tarragon
  • 3 teaspoons chopped fresh cilantro
  • salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Place bacon in a Dutch oven and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, 5 to 10 minutes.
  2. Drain bacon pieces on paper towels and reserve 1/4 cup of the bacon grease in the pan; discard the rest.
  3. Cook celery and onion in the reserved bacon drippings until onion is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
  4. Stir in garlic and continue cooking for 1 to 2 minutes.
  5. Add cubed potatoes and toss to coat; sauté for 3 to 4 minutes.
  6. Return bacon to the pan and add enough chicken stock to just cover the potatoes.
  7. Cover and simmer until potatoes are tender, 15 to 20 minutes.
  8. Meanwhile, melt butter in a separate skillet over medium heat and whisk in flour.
  9. Cook, stirring constantly, for 1 to 2 minutes.
  10. Whisk in heavy cream, dried tarragon, and chopped cilantro.
  11. Bring cream mixture to a boil and cook, stirring constantly, until thickened, about 5 minutes.
  12. Add cream mixture to the potato mixture and stir to combine.
  13. Transfer about half of the soup to a blender and purée until smooth.
  14. Return puréed soup to the Dutch oven and adjust seasonings with salt and pepper to taste.
  15. Serve hot and enjoy!

  9. Cook, stirring constantly, for 1 to 2 minutes to form a roux.
  10. Slowly whisk in heavy cream, dried tarragon, and chopped cilantro.
  11. Bring the cream mixture to a boil and cook, stirring constantly, until thickened, about 5 minutes.
  12. Add the cream mixture to the potato mixture and stir to combine.
  13. Transfer about half of the soup to a blender and purée until smooth, then return to the Dutch oven.
  14. Adjust salt and pepper to taste.
  15. Serve hot, optionally topped with crumbled bacon, green onions, or shredded Cheddar cheese.

Ready in just over half an hour, this homemade pizza offers restaurant-quality flavors faster than delivery, perfect for a cozy dinner at home. | ⏱️ Prep: 10min | Cook: 25min | Serves: 4 | #cat1758062039737 #easyrecipe #1hourmeals #recipe #cooking
item.dc:creator: author_003
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 10 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 25 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 35 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 4

📊 Difficulty: Easy

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 pound prepared pizza dough
  • 1/3 cup vodka sauce
  • 1 (8 ounce) ball fresh mozzarella, sliced
  • 1 ounce shredded Parmesan cheese
  • 6 grape tomatoes, halved
  • 3 basil leaves, sliced into thin ribbons
  • 1/2 teaspoon garlic granules (optional)
  • 2 teaspoons olive oil (optional)

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Lightly grease a 12-inch cake pan.
  2. Stretch and roll out the pizza dough and place it in the prepared pan. Prick the dough with a fork.
  3. Bake the pizza dough in the preheated oven for 5 minutes.
  4. Remove the pizza from the oven and spread vodka sauce evenly over the dough, leaving a 1/2 inch border around the edges.
  5. Arrange mozzarella slices evenly over the sauce and sprinkle with shredded Parmesan cheese.
  6. Bake for 15 minutes more.
  7. Remove the pizza and scatter the halved grape tomatoes on top.
  8. Bake until the crust is golden and the tomatoes are slightly softened, about 5 more minutes.
  9. Remove from oven and garnish with sliced basil leaves.
  10. If desired, mix garlic granules into olive oil and brush along the exposed crust edges.
  11. Cut into 8 to 10 slices and serve immediately.

item.dc:creator: author_003
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 90 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 50 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 140 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 8

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
  • 3 tablespoons white sugar
  • ½ teaspoon salt
  • ½ cup butter, chilled and diced
  • 1 egg yolk
  • 3 tablespoons ice water
  • 1 ½ cups pecan halves
  • 3 eggs
  • 1 cup light corn syrup
  • ¾ cup white sugar
  • 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
  • 3 tablespoons milk
  • 3 tablespoons butter, melted
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. In a large bowl, combine 1 ½ cups flour, 3 tablespoons sugar, and salt.
  2. Cut in the chilled, diced butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
  3. Mix the egg yolk with ice water and stir into the flour mixture until it forms a ball.
  4. Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour or overnight.
  5. Roll out the dough and place it in a 9-inch pie plate.
  6. Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
  7. Place pecan halves evenly in the bottom of the pie crust.
  8. In a large bowl, stir together ¾ cup sugar and 2 tablespoons flour.
  9. Add eggs, corn syrup, milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract; blend well.
  10. Pour the filling over the pecans in the crust.
  11. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes.
  12. Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake for 40 to 50 minutes, or until golden brown and the filling is set.
  13. Allow the pie to cool completely before serving to let the filling firm up.

item.description: This Wonton Crab Grilled Cheese is a delightful fusion of creamy crab Rangoon flavors with the comforting crispiness of grilled cheese. Perfectly toasted inside and out, it offers a crispy, savory bite with a hint of sweet chili sauce that will make your lunch unforgettable. | ⏱️ Prep: 10min | Cook: 10min | Serves: 4 | #cat1758062807185 #easyrecipe #quickrecipe #30minutemeals #recipe
item.dc:creator: author_003
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 10 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 10 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 20 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 4

📊 Difficulty: Easy

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 cup whipped cream cheese
  • 8 ounces imitation crab meat, chopped
  • 1/4 cup chopped green onions
  • 1/4 cup soy sauce
  • 2 teaspoons sesame oil
  • 2 teaspoons garlic powder
  • 1/4 cup mayonnaise
  • 8 thick slices bread
  • 1/4 cup sweet chili sauce, plus more for serving

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. In a bowl, combine cream cheese, chopped crab meat, green onions, soy sauce, sesame oil, and garlic powder. Mix well and set aside.
  2. Spread mayonnaise on one side of each bread slice.
  3. Heat a large skillet over medium heat and toast the bread slices, mayonnaise side down, until golden brown. Remove and set aside.
  4. Spread the crab mixture evenly on the toasted side of 4 bread slices.
  5. Drizzle sweet chili sauce over the crab mixture.
  6. Top with the remaining 4 bread slices, toasted side down.
  7. Spread mayonnaise on the untoasted sides of the sandwiches.
  8. Place sandwiches back into the skillet over medium heat and toast, flipping once, until both sides are golden brown and crispy.
  9. Serve immediately with extra sweet chili sauce on the side.

item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 90 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 50 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 140 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 8

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
  • 3 tablespoons white sugar
  • ½ teaspoon salt
  • ½ cup butter, chilled and diced
  • 1 egg yolk
  • 3 tablespoons ice water
  • 1 ½ cups pecan halves
  • 3 eggs
  • 1 cup light corn syrup
  • ¾ cup white sugar
  • 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
  • 3 tablespoons milk
  • 3 tablespoons butter, melted
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. In a large bowl, combine 1 ½ cups flour, 3 tablespoons sugar, and salt.
  2. Cut in chilled diced butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
  3. Mix egg yolk with ice water and stir into flour mixture until dough forms a ball.
  4. Wrap dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour or overnight.
  5. Roll out dough and place in a 9-inch pie plate.
  6. Preheat oven to 450°F (230°C).
  7. Place pecan halves evenly in the bottom of the pie crust.
  8. In a large bowl, stir together ¾ cup sugar and 2 tablespoons flour.
  9. Mix in eggs, corn syrup, milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract until well blended.
  10. Pour the filling over the pecans in the crust.
  11. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes.
  12. Reduce oven temperature to 350°F (175°C) and bake for 40 to 50 minutes, or until the filling is golden brown and set.
  13. Allow pie to cool completely before serving to let the filling set.

item.dc:creator: author_003
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 30 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 65 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 95 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 8

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • ½ cup white sugar
  • ½ cup light brown sugar
  • ⅛ cup sifted all-purpose flour
  • ¼ teaspoon salt
  • ¼ cup milk
  • ¼ cup margarine
  • 1 egg yolk
  • 1 egg
  • ½ teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 (9 inch) unbaked pie crust

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  2. In a saucepan, combine white sugar, brown sugar, flour, and salt.
  3. Pour in milk and add margarine.
  4. Heat the mixture over medium heat, stirring constantly until the sugar dissolves and margarine melts.
  5. Remove from heat and set aside to cool.
  6. In a large bowl, whisk together egg yolk, whole egg, and vanilla extract until smooth.
  7. Whisk the cooled sugar mixture into the egg mixture until fully combined.
  8. Pour the filling into the unbaked pie crust.
  9. Bake for 25 minutes at 350 degrees F.
  10. Reduce oven temperature to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C) and bake for an additional 25 minutes, or until the top is puffed and edges are golden brown.
  11. Allow the pie to cool completely before slicing and serving.
